This focuses on network topologies, including their physical topologies (star, mesh) as well as their spatial categorization (LAN, WAN).

## Star
* Failures in one link don't impact other links
* Centralized device (e.g. ethernet switch) is single point of failure
* Popular in modern networks

![IMAGE](quiver-image-url/51B8511B8F16369C37611C3425D50C01.jpg =1592x860)

## Mesh
Links between centralized devices, e.g. switches in a WAN connecting multiple offices.

A mesh requires lots of links! `(N * (N - 1)) / 2`.

A full mesh has optimal direct links between every device, whereas a partial might have to route through an intermediate device. This makes partial meshes less expensive in terms of bandwidth / setup cost, but might be more expensive to maintain from a human resources perspective.
